title: The sixth Cultural Deal for Europe policy conversation calls for culture and civil society to shape Europe’s future strategic agenda
content:
The sixth edition of the annual Cultural Deal for Europe Policy Conversation, entitled “When Culture Wins, Europe Wins”, took place on 3 February 2026 at BOZAR in Brussels, bringing together over 250 participants — policymakers, representatives of civil society, and cultural and heritage stakeholders from across Europe. The event reaffirmed the essential role of culture and cultural heritage in shaping Europe’s future, particularly in relation to democracy, social cohesion, resilience and long-term strategic priorities.

Photo by Chris Marchal

 

Co-organised by Europa Nostr
creator: Joana Pinheiro
sourceDescription: The Voice of Cultural Heritage in Europe

title: European experts renew call for decisive action to preserve the Iron Gate of Antioch in Türkiye
content: On 6 February 2026, the third anniversary of the devastating earthquakes that struck southern Türkiye, the publication of the Technical Report on the Iron Gate of Antioch by a European expert team marks both a moment of remembrance and a renewed call to action. Following a nomination made by Europa Nostra Türkiye in 2023, the Iron Gate of Antioch in Antakya / Hatay province, Türkiye, was listed among the 7 Most Endangered heritage sites in Europe in 2024 by Europa Nostra, in the frame of its
creator: Joana Pinheiro
sourceDescription: The Voice of Cultural Heritage in Europe
